question: Which apostle was a tax collector before following Jesus?
explanation: Matthew (also called Levi) was a tax collector when Jesus called him to be a disciple.

question: What were the occupations of Peter and Andrew before becoming disciples?
explanation: Peter and Andrew were fishermen casting their nets when Jesus called them to become fishers of men.

question: Which apostle is known as 'Doubting' because he questioned Jesus' resurrection?
explanation: Thomas doubted the resurrection until he saw and touched Jesus' wounds, leading to his famous declaration of faith.

question: What was Peter's original name before Jesus renamed him?
explanation: Jesus renamed Simon to Cephas (Peter), which means rock.

question: On what road was Paul traveling when he encountered Jesus?
explanation: Saul (Paul) was on his way to Damascus to persecute Christians when Jesus appeared to him in a blinding light.

question: What was Judas Iscariot's role among the disciples?
explanation: Judas kept the money bag and was a thief who used to help himself to what was put into it.

question: How did Judas identify Jesus to the soldiers?
explanation: Judas had arranged a signal: 'The one I kiss is the man; arrest him.'

question: Which apostle did Jesus call the 'rock'?
explanation: Jesus said to Peter, 'You are Peter (rock), and on this rock I will build my church.'

question: What was Peter doing when Jesus called him?
explanation: Jesus told Peter to put out into deep water and let down the nets for a catch.

question: Which apostle asked to see Jesus' hands and side?
explanation: Thomas said, 'Unless I see the nail marks in his hands and put my finger where the nails were, I will not believe.'

question: How many apostles did Jesus choose?
explanation: Jesus called his twelve disciples to him and gave them authority to drive out impure spirits.

question: Who was stoned to death, becoming the first Christian martyr?
explanation: While they were stoning him, Stephen prayed, 'Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.'

question: Who cut off the high priest's servant's ear?
explanation: Simon Peter had a sword and drew it, striking the high priest's servant and cutting off his right ear.

question: How many times did Peter deny Jesus?
explanation: Peter remembered what Jesus had said: 'Before the rooster crows, you will disown me three times.'

question: What was Paul's occupation?
explanation: Because he was a tentmaker as they were, he stayed and worked with them.

question: Which apostle was called 'the beloved disciple'?
explanation: One of them, the disciple whom Jesus loved, was reclining next to him.

question: Which apostle was a tax collector?
explanation: As Jesus went on from there, he saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax collector's booth.

question: Which apostle walked on water with Jesus?
explanation: Then Peter got down out of the boat, walked on the water and came toward Jesus.

question: Which apostle doubted Jesus' resurrection until he saw and touched Jesus' wounds?
explanation: Thomas said he would not believe unless he could put his finger in the nail marks and his hand in Jesus' side.

question: Which apostle wrote the most New Testament books?
explanation: Paul wrote 13 or 14 epistles (if Hebrews is included), the most of any New Testament author.

question: Which apostle was present at Jesus' transfiguration?
explanation: Jesus took Peter, James and John up a high mountain where He was transfigured.

question: Who was the apostle to the Gentiles?
explanation: I am talking to you Gentiles. Inasmuch as I am the apostle to the Gentiles, I take pride in my ministry.

question: Which apostle brought his brother to Jesus?
explanation: The first thing Andrew did was to find his brother Simon and tell him, 'We have found the Messiah.'

question: Which apostle doubted Jesus' resurrection until he saw Him?
explanation: So the other disciples told him, 'We have seen the Lord!' But he said, 'Unless I see the nail marks... I will not believe.'

question: Which apostle cut off the servant's ear in Gethsemane?
explanation: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the high priest's servant, cutting off his right ear.

question: Which apostle was fishing when Jesus called him to be a fisher of men?
explanation: As Jesus was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon called Peter and his brother Andrew. They were casting a net into the lake, for they were fishermen. 'Come, follow me,' Jesus said, 'and I will send you out to fish for people.'

question: Who was Peter's brother?
explanation: As Jesus was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon called Peter and his brother Andrew.

question: Which apostle did Jesus love?
explanation: Having loved his own who were in the world, he loved them to the end. Jesus loved all His disciples.

question: Which apostle wrote the most epistles?
explanation: Paul wrote 13 or 14 epistles, more than any other New Testament writer.

question: Where was Paul when he was blinded by a great light?
explanation: As he neared Damascus on his journey, suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him.
